title: 115_hr5938
content: The "Veterans Serving Veterans Act of 2018" may be cited as the short title. It includes a section on a recruitment database. The "Veterans Serving Veterans Act of 2018" includes amendments to establish a single searchable database called the 'Departments of Defense and Veterans Affairs Recruitment Database' for vacant positions. The "Veterans Serving Veterans Act of 2018" establishes a single searchable database for vacant positions in the Departments of Defense and Veterans Affairs. The database includes information on military occupational specialties, qualified members of the Armed Forces, and additional details for recruitment purposes. The database established under the "Veterans Serving Veterans Act of 2018" provides information on qualified members of the Armed Forces, including their contact details, expected discharge date, and military occupational specialties. This information is accessible to Department of Veterans Affairs personnel, and expedited hiring procedures are in place for vacant positions listed in the database. The "Veterans Serving Veterans Act of 2018" allows for a relocation bonus for qualified members of the Armed Forces accepting positions listed in the database. Amendments include changes to subsections regarding bonuses and annual reporting requirements. The "Veterans Serving Veterans Act of 2018" defines a qualified member of the Armed Forces as someone meeting specific criteria and outlines an implementation plan to be submitted by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The VA Choice and Quality Employment Act (Public Law 115-46; 38 U.S.C. 701 note) has been amended in section 208. SEC. 3. INTERMEDIATE CARE TECHNICIAN TRAINING PROGRAM. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to train and certify covered veterans as intermediate care technicians in the Department of Veterans Affairs. Centers will be set up at selected medical facilities for this purpose, based on their experience and resources for training technicians. The term "covered veteran" in this section refers to a veteran who served as a basic health care technician in the Armed Forces, as determined by the Secretary. No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated for carrying out the requirements of this Act and its amendments. The sections mentioned will be funded using existing authorized amounts.
